questions.question_text:
You have a SharePoint Server farm.
You need to implement hybrid search.
Which two service applications are required for hybrid search? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

discussion.content:
The cloud SSA lets you crawl and add metadata from on-premises content to the search index in Office 365. 
it should be Cloud SSA and User Profile Application
This is for hybrid search. You need cloud search service application. Not sure about the second one

comments.content: This article talks about hybrid environments in general. Nothing to do with this question!

discussion.content:
Answer should be A and E.
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/sharepoint/hybrid/set-up-sharepoint-services-for-hybrid-environments

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT -
You have two SharePoint Server farms named Farm1 and Farm2.
In Farm1, you need to display search results from both farms.
What should you use? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
//IMG//

comments.content: workload 4 is possible with a data gateway

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -
You are planning the implementation of a SharePoint hybrid environment that will contain the following workloads:
✑ Workload1: An external list exposing data from a public OData service endpoint.
✑ Workload2: An external list exposing data from a Microsoft Azure SQL database.
✑ Workload3: A site that contains a sandbox solution.
✑ Workload4: A Microsoft Flow workload.
Which workload can run only in the SharePoint Server farm and which workload can run only in SharePoint Online? To answer, drag the appropriate workloads to the correct environments. Each workload may be used once, more than once, or not at all. You may need to drag the split bar between panes or scroll to view content.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

DRAG DROP -
Your company has a SharePoint Server hybrid deployment.
You are creating a Microsoft Azure logic app that must access data from a list hosted in your SharePoint Server on-premises environment.
You need to ensure that the logic app can access data from the list. All communication to the on-premises environment must be done through an encrypted channel.
Which three actions should you perform in sequence? To answer, move all actions from the list of actions to the answer area and arrange them in the correct order.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

discussion.content:
you configure the https connectivity in the data Gateway . I think the order must be:
Install the on-premises data Gateway
Configure connectivity to use https
Use Sharepoint connector from the logic app

comments.content:
SharePoint Online users want to see onprem search results. Therefore the remote result source must be configured in SharePoint Online.
Answer a is correct.

discussion.content:
should the answer be B?
Inbound: In an inbound scenario, a remote result source will only be configured in the SharePoint Online search center. Inbound can be defined as the ability to query only from SharePoint Online farm to on-premise farm.
Outbound: In an outbound scenario, a remote result source will only be configured in the on-premises SharePoint Server farm. Outbound can be defined as the ability to only query from the on-premises farm to SharePoint Online search farm.

choices.C: From SharePoint Online, create a query rule.
choices.B: From on-premises SharePoint Server, create a Remote SharePoint result source.
choices.A: From SharePoint Online, create a Remote SharePoint result source.
choices.D: From on-premises SharePoint Server, configure a Secure Store Service application.

questions.question_text:
You have a SharePoint Server farm and a SharePoint Online subscription.
You implement inbound hybrid search.
You need to ensure that SharePoint Online users can return search results from the farm.
What should you do?
